key_title: Key to the species of Cylindropuntia

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Cactaceae

leads.lead_text: Cladodes < 12 mm diameter, with 0–4 spines per areole
Cladodes > 15 mm diameter, with cladodes with (2–)4–24 spines per areole
Cladodes 6–12 mm diameter, tuberculate; flowers 30–50 mm diameter, red to magenta; fruit tuberculate, yellowish orange to brownish orange
Cladodes 3–5.5 mm diameter, weakly tuberculate (except at apex and when dry); flowers 10–15 mm diameter, yellow; fruit smooth, red
Majority of spines 20–40 mm long; spine sheaths very obvious, loosely attached
Majority of spines < 20 mm long or with only 1–2 spines to 30 mm long; spine sheaths obscure, firmly attached
Spines per areole 7–14, white to cream, sometimes the spines at apex of cladode tipped brown; spine sheath (fresh) white, aging pale yellow when dry; petaloids magenta
Spines per areole 4–7, reddish brown to yellowish brown; spine sheath (fresh) yellowish to tan; petaloids yellow

Large shrub to small tree 1–4 m tall; cladode tubercles usually 20–50 mm, widely spaced; cladode spines 8–30 mm long; fruits with 18–30 areoles, tubercles nearly equal in length or longer in proximal portion of fruit
Shrubs 1–2 m tall; cladode tubercles usually 5–15 mm, crowded; cladode spines (4–)8–15 mm long; fruits with 28–50 or more areoles, tubercles longer in distal portion of fruit
